channel.title: Smart Sound Monitoring
channel.description: Recent content on Smart Sound Monitoring

item.title: Week 6
item.description: In the 3rd meeting with our project assistent, we confirmed the necessary features for the intermediate delivery, namely the acquisition of pure sinusoids and its representation in both time and frequency domains.

item.title: Week 5
item.description: In the 5th week of the project we began working on the Arduino Nano RP2040.

item.title: Week 5
item.description: In the 5th week of the project we began working on the Arduino Nano RP2040.

item.title: Week 4
item.description: In the 4th week of the project we met with our project assistent, Professor Rafael Cordeiro, to discuss the goals for the intermediate delivery of April 1st.

item.title: Week 3
item.description: This week we had the opportunity to interview sound technicias who work for Watt-Light, the company that was hired by the Electrical and Computer Engineering student team for their anual event.

item.title: Weeks 1 and 2
item.description: In the first two weeks we had the opportunity to interview sound professionals and possible Smart Sound Monitoring clients.

item.title: Hello, World!
item.description: The Smart Sound Monitoring website is officially up and running. Essential information and features are both available and functional.

item.title: Website Development
item.description: Beginning of the development of the Smart Sound Monitoring website.
